## Description {#details}

This file contains the declarations of the Vectorization Plan base classes:

<ul>
<li>VPBasicBlock and VPRegionBlock that inherit from a common pure virtual VPBlockBase, together implementing a Hierarchical CFG;</li>
<li>Pure virtual VPRecipeBase serving as the base class for recipes contained within VPBasicBlocks;</li>
<li>Pure virtual VPSingleDefRecipe serving as a base class for recipes that also inherit from VPValue.</li>
<li>VPInstruction, a concrete Recipe and VPUser modeling a single planned instruction;</li>
<li>The VPlan class holding a candidate for vectorization;</li>
<li>The VPlanPrinter class providing a way to print a plan in dot format; These are documented in docs/VectorizationPlan.rst.</li>
</ul>

<Link id="l02008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2008"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A pure virtual base class for all recipes modeling header phis, including</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2009"><Highlight kind="comment">/// phis for first order recurrences, pointer inductions and reductions. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2010"><Highlight kind="comment">/// start value is the first operand of the recipe and the incoming value from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2011"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the backedge is the second operand.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2012"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2013"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Inductions are modeled using the following sub-classes:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2014"><Highlight kind="comment">///  &#42; VPCanonicalIVPHIRecipe: Canonical scalar induction of the vector loop,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2015"><Highlight kind="comment">///    starting at a specified value (zero for the main vector loop, the resume</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2016"><Highlight kind="comment">///    value for the epilogue vector loop) and stepping by 1 The induction</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2017"><Highlight kind="comment">///    controls exiting of the vector loop by comparing against the vector trip</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2018"><Highlight kind="comment">///    count. Produces a single scalar PHI for the induction value per</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2019"><Highlight kind="comment">///    iteration.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2020"><Highlight kind="comment">///  &#42; VPWidenIntOrFpInductionRecipe: Generates vector values for integer and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2021"><Highlight kind="comment">///    floating point inductions with arbitrary start and step values. Produces</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2022"><Highlight kind="comment">///    a vector PHI per-part.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2023"><Highlight kind="comment">///  &#42; VPDerivedIVRecipe: Converts the canonical IV value to the corresponding</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2024"><Highlight kind="comment">///    value of an IV with different start and step values. Produces a single</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2025"><Highlight kind="comment">///    scalar value per iteration</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2026"><Highlight kind="comment">///  &#42; VPScalarIVStepsRecipe: Generates scalar values per-lane based on a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2027"><Highlight kind="comment">///    canonical or derived induction.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2028"><Highlight kind="comment">///  &#42; VPWidenPointerInductionRecipe: Generate vector and scalar values for a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2029"><Highlight kind="comment">///    pointer induction. Produces either a vector PHI per-part or scalar values</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2030"><Highlight kind="comment">///    per-lane based on the canonical induction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2031" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vpheaderphirecipe"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vpheaderphirecipe/#a7251449378efb98a9e3f03a2016a060d">VPHeaderPHIRecipe</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vpsingledefrecipe/#a698c2c1cbd9f6caace410d3733bb17b9">VPSingleDefRecipe</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2032"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">protected</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3708"><Highlight kind="comment">/// VPRegionBlock represents a collection of VPBasicBlocks and VPRegionBlocks</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3709"><Highlight kind="comment">/// which form a Single-Entry-Single-Exiting subgraph of the output IR CFG.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3710"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A VPRegionBlock may indicate that its contents are to be replicated several</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3711"><Highlight kind="comment">/// times. This is designed to support predicated scalarization, in which a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3712"><Highlight kind="comment">/// scalar if-then code structure needs to be generated VF &#42; UF times. Having</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3713"><Highlight kind="comment">/// this replication indicator helps to keep a single model for multiple</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3714"><Highlight kind="comment">/// candidate VF&#39;s. The actual replication takes place only once the desired VF</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3715"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and UF have been determined.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
